TestDescription.name: Long password denial of service
TestDescription.Description: By sending a very long password (1.000.000 characters) it's possible to cause a denial a service attack on the server. This may lead to the website becoming unavailable or unresponsive. Usually this problem is caused by a vulnerable password hashing implementation. When a long password is sent, the password hashing process will result in CPU and memory exhaustion. [break][break] This vulnerability was detected by sending passwords with various lengths and comparing the measured response times. Consult details for more information.
TestDescription.Impact: An atacker may cause the website to become temporarily/indefinitely unavailable or unresponsive.
TestDescription.Recommendation: The password hashing implementation must be fixed to limit the maximum length of accepted passwords.
